title: Fleabag reunion as Olivia Colman and Phoebe Waller-Bridge record duet
text:
Olivia Colman gave us the Fleabag reunion we’ve all been waiting for as she teamed up with Phoebe Waller-Bridge to record a track for Children in Need.

The 45-year-old actress and national treasure took part in Children in Need: Got It Covered, which saw a group of world-class British actors – including Helena Bonham Carter, Adrian Lester and Jim Broadbent – record their own versions of their favourite songs for the BBC charity.

But if you’re thinking an Oscar, Bafta and Golden Globe-winning actress like Olivia wouldn’t get nervous about a fun little song, you’d be wrong.

Calling recording the track ‘the scariest thing I’ve ever done,’ The Crown star attempted to calm her nerves by roping in her on-screen goddaughter Phoebe Waller-Bridge to accompany her on the ukulele for her version of Glory Box by Portishead.

Phoebe is well known for playing the instrument in her first sitcom Crashing and was joined by her musician sister Isobel Waller-Bridge, who composed the music for Fleabag.

‘I mustn’t look at them because I’ll probably giggle, but they’ve been practicing,’ Olivia explained.

We’re not crying, there’s just a Fleabag in our eye (Picture: BBC)

Too emotional (Picture: BBC)

‘Phoebe sent me a video practicing on a piece of paper where she’d drawn the strings. Not sure how that’s going to sound.’

But despite the mother-of-three saying that she’d ‘rather give birth again with no drugs than do this’ (yikes), Phoebe arrived to the recording session at the iconic Abbey Road Studios and insisted Olivia had nothing to worry about.

‘I first knew that Olivia could sing at karaoke because she’s one of those dark horses that is just sort of like, “Oh, I don’t really, I don’t really,” but then she does and she brings it and just burns the place down.’

PWB had some great stories about Olivia’s karaoke habits (Picture: BBC)

‘It’s been a dream to support her musically, with her first ever single, I think.’

Us, jealous? At the idea of Phoebe Waller-Bridge and Olivia Colman doing karaoke together? Yeah right…

Olivia got her confidence back with Phoebe’s help (Picture: BBC)

Reuniting in the studio, Olivia gave the girls the biggest hugs, melting our hearts in the process and leaving us desperate for another series (maybe one where Fleabag and the Godmother are secretly best friends?).

And the recording team were impressed by how at ease Phoebe let Olivia feel, commenting: ‘Olivia’s singing well, isn’t she? She’s very relaxed.’

What a transformation!
